visualization_prompt: Generate an item chart showing political party representation distribution using synthetic electoral data with ≥10 categories and party-aligned color encoding
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains categorical (political parties) and quantitative (seat counts) variables, structured as nominal and ratio scales respectively. Synthetic data follows German parliamentary constraints (total 736 seats), with party colors matching official branding. Values exhibit power-law distribution (μ=143.6, σ=185.2) reflecting real political fragmentation trends. The item chart maximizes data-ink ratio by encoding quantities through spatial frequency of identically sized elements, complying with Tufte's principles. Cairo's perceptual hierarchy is implemented through chromatic coding (party colors) and typographic emphasis (bold labels vs. semi-transparent counts). Proportional area allocation (16-row grid) maintains accurate magnitude perception while enabling party identification through pre-attentive color attributes.
